articles.title: Siri, You’re Fired!

articles.title: Jack Dorsey-Backed Spiral Plots Course for Mainstream Adoption of Bitcoin’s Lightning Network

articles.description: Formula 1’s crypto presence shrank in recent months, but the pool is growing again as Kraken teams up with Williams Racing.
articles.title: F1 Team Adds Crypto Sponsor in Kraken After FTX, Tezos Exits

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: Cloud-based infrastructure can save costs—but may also be an attractive avenue for criminals.
articles.title: North Korean Hackers Use Cloud Mining Services to Launder Dirty Crypto

articles.title: Microsoft Unveils Security Copilot, a Cybersecurity Tool That Uses Generative AI

articles.description: The Justice Department is currently appealing a judge’s approval of a deal that allows Binance’s U.S. affiliate to acquire Voyager’s distressed assets.
articles.title: CFTC Lawsuit Won't Affect Binance's Acquisition of Voyager, Experts Say

articles.description: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC

articles.description: The FTX founder now faces a total of 13 criminal charges in connection with the collapse of the crypto exchange.
articles.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Charged With Bribing Chinese Government Officials

articles.description: Binance CEO CZ responded to the CFTC’s lawsuit, stating that its complaint "appears to contain an incomplete recitation of facts."
articles.title: BNB Slips Over 5% Following Binance CFTC Lawsuit

articles.author: Andrew Asmakov
articles.description: Zero-knowledge proofs developed by Ethereum scaling firm StarkWare are now making a debut on the Bitcoin blockchain.
articles.title: Tested on Ethereum, StarkWare’s Zero-Knowledge Proofs Are Now Live on Bitcoin

articles.description: Recent Disney layoffs have seen its metaverse unit of 50 completely cut from the company while the head of the team remains.
articles.title: Disney Cuts Metaverse Unit Amid Company-Wide Layoffs: Report

articles.description: A month after launching Chiliz Chain 2.0, the project’s CEO is eager to get more developers and projects to start building on it.

articles.title: New AI Tool Named for Warren Buffett Makes Quick Work of Corporate Filings

articles.description: Brands like Dolce & Gabbana and Coach will display their digital wares in an event spanning three metaverse platforms. Here's how it will work.

articles.description: Nvidia caters to gamers, but also sells hardware explicitly designed for crypto mining. Now its CTO is slamming crypto and pushing AI instead.
articles.title: Nvidia Says Crypto Adds Nothing to Society, Despite Profiting From Mining

articles.description: The Ethereum creator was described as a “man of culture” after setting the gas limit on the network’s first-ever transaction to "69042."
articles.title: Vitalik Buterin Sends Hidden Message in First Polygon zkEVM Transaction

articles.description: Luxury fashion brand Gucci is taking further steps into Web3 with Yuga Labs, with first plans set to get underway this week.
articles.title: Gucci Reveals Metaverse Tie-Up With Bored Ape Creator Yuga Labs

articles.description: After developing the feature with the metal band, Ticketmaster is offering artists a token-gated option for exclusive ticket access.
articles.title: Ticketmaster Debuts NFT-Gated Ticket Sales, Starting With Avenged Sevenfold

articles.description: The regulator's lawsuit alleges that Binance violated derivative trading rules in the U.S.

articles.description: A recent filing with the SEC revealed that Microstrategy has conveniently paid off its loan with the failed Silvergate Bank.

articles.description: It’s the final mainnet from Polygon, but co-founder Mihailo Bjelic advises proceeding with caution when using the new zkEVM.

articles.description: After SushiSwap, DeFi exchange dYdX is also making the leap to Cosmos, citing slow transaction speeds on Ethereum.

articles.title: 'Skull of Satoshi' Artist Says He Was 'Wrong' About Bitcoin Mining

articles.title: First Citizens Bank Enters Deal With FDIC to Buy Silicon Valley Bank

articles.title: Painter Lee Mullican’s Pioneering 1987 Digital Art Released via Tezos NFTs

articles.description: As new DAOs emerge left and right, figuring out how they stack up against one another is often an apples-to-oranges job for analysts.

articles.description: The banking network collapse from earlier this month poses a significant risk to the health of the crypto market.

articles.description: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.
articles.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet

articles.author: Andrew Throuvalas
articles.description: ARK invest sold Coinbase shares on Tuesday, then bought an even larger haul on Thursday after word of the SEC's warning tanked the price.
articles.title: Cathie Wood Buys the Dip on Coinbase Stock Two Days After Dumping

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: Neil Gaiman and the Winklevoss twins are among the subjects in Aversano's tarot-inspired photo set, exhibiting in Los Angeles from Saturday.
articles.title: From ‘Twin Flames’ to Tarot: Justin Aversano Exhibits ‘Smoke and Mirrors’ Photo NFTs

articles.description: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved

articles.author: Jose Antonio Lanz
articles.description: The moves come amidst an anti-corruption investigation that has brought an arrest, resignation, and a national scandal.
articles.title: Venezuela Regulator Shuts Down Some Cryptocurrency Exchanges and Mining Farms

articles.description: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.
articles.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: Most of the eligible users of the popular Ethereum scaling solution didn’t wait to claim the free Arbitrum (ARB) tokens.
articles.title: Arbitrum Settles Into Top 40 Coins With 81% of Airdrop Claimed

articles.description: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.
articles.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect

articles.description: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.
articles.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris

articles.description: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt’s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros’ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.
articles.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris

articles.description: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.
articles.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'

articles.description: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.
articles.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity

articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.
articles.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Galaxy Digital held its Fourth Quarter 2022 Shareholder Update Conference Call on March 28, during which CEO Mike Novogratz addressed a variety of pressing issues impacting the industry. 
 
From the collapse of the once might crypto exchange FTX to the U.S. banking crisis, Novogratz offered his insight into the current state of the market and the challenges facing it. With regulatory pressure mounting, the call provided an opportunity for shareholders to gain valuable insights into the company’s strategic direction.
 
But perhaps one of the best highlights of the call, as evidenced in the transcript, was Novogratz expressing surprise at the level of regulatory scrutiny being placed on the cryptocurrency industry, rather than on artificial intelligence (AI). 
 
He argued that the U.S. gover…
articles.title: Galaxy Digital CEO Says The Gov’t Should Be Scared Of AI And Not Crypto

articles.author: Terence Zimwara
articles.description:
The central bank in the United Arab Emirates said it has started implementing its digital currency strategy with partners G42 Cloud and R3. According to the central bank, the digital currency initiative is expected to “further position and solidify the UAE as a leading global financial hub.”
 
CBDC Strategy to Focus on Three Pillars
 
The United Arab Emirates (UAE) central bank recently said it would start implementing its digital currency strategy with its two partners G42 Cloud and R3. According to a report, the UAE’s apex bank’s two partners are expected to play a key role in helping the central bank achieve CBDC implementation.
 
As explained in a recent Arabian Business report, the first phase of the central bank’s strategy, which is expected to take place in the next 12 to 15 months,…
articles.title: Report: UAE Central Bank Implements Digital Currency Strategy

articles.author: Jake Simmons
articles.description:
Following recent actions by US authorities against the US crypto industry, Operation Choke Point 2.0 has become more apparent than ever. At the center of the campaign is the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), which recently sent a Well Notice to Coinbase and brought forth a lawsuit against crypto mogul Justin Sun over fraud and other securities law violations.
 
Oversight of the SEC actions by the US Congress has been effectively non-existent so far. However, this is now set to change. In an interview with Punchbowl News, Patrick McHenry, chairman of the Financial Services Committee, disclosed that SEC chairman Gary Gensler will have to testify before the committee for the first time on April 18 to justify his actions.
 
The United States House Committee on Financial Services is …
articles.title: SEC Chair Gensler Faces Scrutiny Over Crypto Policy From Congress, Mark This Date

articles.author: Shaurya Malwa
articles.description: A publicly-available token burn function in the contract allowed attackers to manipulate the protocol, some said.
articles.title: Safemoon LP Exploited for $8.9M; SFM Tokens Remain ‘Safe,' CEO Says

articles.author: Arnab Shome
articles.description:
The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) has asked cryptocurrency clients of collapsed Signature Bank to close their accounts by April 5 by finding another banking partner. Otherwise, the regulator will close the accounts and mail a check to the registered addresses.

Signature Bank's Crypto Clients Get a Deadline

The FIDC's decision on Tuesday came following the acquisition of Signature Bank's deposits and loans by Flagstar Bank, a part of the New York Community Bancorp (NYCB). However, the deal with the FIDC did not include the "approximately $4 billion of deposits related to the former Signature Bank's digital banking…
articles.title: Signature Bank's Crypto Depositors Get April 5 Account Closure Deadline

articles.author: Christian Encila
articles.description:
Ticketmaster is partnering with Avenged Sevenfold to launch its Ethereum NFT token-gating feature, in a bid to put an end to scalping, bot activity, and long wait times. As part of this partnership, the heavy metal band tested the feature with its Deathbats Club NFT collection prior to its full integration. 
 
This marks the first time that Ticketmaster is offering token-gated integration for direct ticket purchases, after previously issuing over 5 million NFTs as commemorative tokens for major events like the Super Bowl.
 
At present, Ticketmaster’s token-gated sales are functioning without any glitches for tokens that are minted on Ethereum and held in dApp wallets such as Coinbase or MetaMask. Fans have already utilized this feature to buy tickets for various major events, and now it wi…
articles.title: Avenged Sevenfold Tour: Ticketmaster Pilots NFT-Enabled Pre-Sales For Ticket Priority

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
According to the token protocol startup Noble, the second-largest stablecoin, USDC, will be integrated into the Cosmos blockchain, as the company has partnered with Circle Financial for the rollout. Noble details that the integration will give access to Circle’s USDC stablecoin to more than 50 Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) networks.
 
USDC Native Support Is Coming to the Cosmos Blockchain
 
Noble, a token issuance protocol startup, has revealed the Cosmos network of IBC protocols will support USDC. The team introduced Noble last week in a blog post that describes the protocol as an “app-chain purpose-built for native asset issuance in Cosmos and the boundless Inter-Blockchain Communication (IBC) ecosystem.” On Tuesday, Noble announced its partnership with Circle Financial to bring U…
articles.title: Noble Partners With Circle Financial to Integrate USDC on Cosmos Blockchain

articles.author: Amitoj Singh
articles.description: Blockchain protocol Algorand (ALGO) has entered the world’s most populous country, India, with a project that aims to support the nation’s transformation from the back office of the Web2 world to the innovation hub of the Web3 world.
articles.title: The Algorand Foundation Branches Out to India

articles.author: Sam Reynolds
articles.description: Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs) are beginning to look like general partnerships in the eyes of U.S. courts.
articles.title: The Liability of DAOs and Their Founders Has Been Put to the Test in Court

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
Binance CEO Changpeng Zhao (CZ) has addressed the allegations against him by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC). “We do not agree with the characterization of many of the issues alleged in the complaint,” the executive stressed.
 
CZ Responds to CFTC’s Allegations
 
The CEO of cryptocurrency exchange Binance, Changpeng Zhao (CZ), published a blog post on Monday to address the civil enforcement action against him and his crypto exchange by the U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC). The U.S. regulator charged Zhao and three entities that operate the Binance platform “with numerous violations of the Commodity Exchange Act (CEA) and CFTC regulations.”
 
Noting that the CFTC’s civil complaint against him and Binance was “unexpected” and “disappointing,” Zhao explain…
articles.title: Binance CEO CZ Responds to US Regulator’s Charges

articles.author: Sam Reynolds
articles.description: Bitcoin is flat, but ether is up, on potentially favorable comments by the CFTC before Congress.
articles.title: First Mover Asia: Will CFTC's Action Against Binance Benefit Crypto’s Asia Narrative?

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
The president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis, Neel Kashkari, says the current banking crisis has pushed the U.S. economy closer to a recession. “We have fundamental issues, regulatory issues facing our banking system,” the Fed official stressed.
 
Neel Kashkari on U.S. Economy, Banking Crisis, Recession
 
Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari shared his thoughts on the state of the U.S. economy, the current banking crisis, and whether the U.S. is headed toward a recession in an interview with CBS News Sunday.
 
Responding to a question about whether the present banking crisis has caused the U.S. economy to edge closer toward a recession, Kashkari said:
 

It definitely brings us closer. Right now, what’s unclear for us is how much of these banking stresses…
articles.title: Fed Bank President: Banking Crisis Tips US Economy Toward Recession

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
Former Assistant Secretary for Public Affairs for the U.S. Department of the Treasury Monica Crowley has warned of “catastrophic” consequences if the U.S. dollar loses its status as the world’s reserve currency. “That would mean the end of the U.S. dollar,” she said, predicting that “there would be a complete implosion of the global economic system.”
 
Crowley Warns of ‘Catastrophic’ Consequences if the U.S. Dollar Loses Global Reserve Currency Status
 
Monica Crowley, former Assistant Secretary for Public Affairs for the U.S. Department of the Treasury, explained on Fox News Saturday what would happen if emerging economies move away from the U.S. dollar towards the Chinese yuan and the USD is no longer the world’s dominant currency. She stressed:
 

It’s really hard to overstate exactly h…
articles.title: Former Treasury Official Warns of Complete Economic Implosion if US Dollar Loses Global Reserve Currency Status

articles.author: Samuel Edyme
articles.description:
While the European government is still working on its regulatory approach towards cryptocurrency regulation, a part of the body, which is the lawmakers, have earlier today published a new rule targeting crypto users with unverified identities.
 
The law which has just been passed wasn’t solely aimed at crypto specifically but at the act of money laundering or anonymously holding and transacting digital assets. The announcement read, “new EU measures against money laundering and terrorist financing.”
 
 
Limits Imposed On Unverified Crypto Users
 
Per a press release, the European Parliament and other lawmakers on the Economics and Civil Liberties committees on March 28 voted on new measures of anti-money laundering (AML) and terrorist financing regulation. Included in the new law was an im…
articles.title: European Lawmakers Impose €1000 Limit On Unverified Crypto Users

articles.author: Jesse Hamilton
articles.description: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. (FDIC) is trying to hurry the stranded crypto customers out the door of the temporary entity that holds the assets of the former Signature Bank, asking them to cash out by next week – whether they have a new bank or not.
articles.title: FDIC Gives Deadline Next Week for Crypto Depositors Stranded by Signature Failure

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
According to a recent white paper published by four members of the law firm Cooper & Kirk, PLLC, U.S. bank regulators are attempting to “drive crypto businesses out of the financial system.” The paper, titled “Operation Chokepoint 2.0,” claims that after laying the groundwork by labeling lawful businesses as “reputationally risky,” federal bank regulators, with the help of state officials, “turned to the task of purging their accounts from each of the banks subject to their supervision.”
 
Constitutional Issues Raised by Operation Chokepoint 2.0: Depriving Businesses of Due Process and Key Structural Constitutional Protections
 
Five days ago, Bitcoin.com News published an article that examines recent discussions in the crypto community regarding “Operation Chokepoint” and why crypto propo…
articles.title: Law Firm’s White Paper Claims US Bank Regulators Are Waging a ‘Clandestine Financial War’ Against Crypto Businesses

articles.author: Hououin Kyouma
articles.description:
Despite CFTC suing Binance, Bitcoin on-chain data has so far shown no signs of FUD developing among traders on the cryptocurrency exchange.
 
Bitcoin On-Chain Metrics Related To Binance Are So Far All Normal
 
Yesterday, news came out that the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC) has filed a lawsuit against Binance and its CEO, Changpeng Zhao, for violating derivatives trading rules in the US. Following the announcement, the market reacted with the price of Bitcoin, which went below the $27,000 level.
 
Users on the exchange itself, however, seem to be calm so far. As an analyst in a CryptoQuant post explained, FUD around the exchange is currently not visible in BTC on-chain data.
 
The first relevant indicator here is the exchange netflow, which measures the net amount of Bitcoi…
articles.title: Bitcoin On-Chain Data Shows No Signs Of FUD Among Binance Users
